basics.name: Hassan Maissoro
basics.label: PhD Student in Statistics
basics.summary: As I approach the completion of my PhD in Applied Mathematics, I will be available for new opportunities starting February 2025. I am actively seeking post-doctoral positions or roles in industry or finance where I can leverage my expertise to contribute to innovative projects.

work.name: DataStorm
work.summary: Research on estimation and prediction for irregular trajectories through functional data analysis. Projects for DataStorm clients.
highlights: Application: Load curves of electricity production and consumption.
Implementation of developed methods in C++, R, and Python.
Supervisor of an Intership on the estimation of the regularity of noisy functional data.
Short- and medium-term forecasts of hydroelectric park production.
R package for deploying hydroelectric production forecast models.
MCO of a Shiny app for forecasting calls for an energy provider's call centers.
MCO of a Shiny app for analyzing simulations of the electrical grid's behavior.
Data preparation and student supervision for the ENSAE Business Data Challenge.

work.name: DataStorm
work.summary: Anomaly detection in a collection of noisy curves.
highlights: Theoretical study and R implementation of depth functions for data.

work.name: Inserm - Délégation Régionale Paris 5
work.summary: Improvement of a Shiny application for medical literature mining.
highlights: Queried PubMed REST API to retrieve articles and extracted keywords using NLP.

work.name: Consortium pour la Recherche Économique et Sociale (CRES)
work.summary: Study of income inequality and its evolution in Togo.
highlights: Econometric methods and decomposition of inequality indices.

work.name: Institut National de la Statistique du Niger
work.summary: Study of determinants of food insecurity in Niger.
highlights: Survey data cleaning, imputation, reweighting, GLM.

work.name: Institut National de la Statistique du Niger
work.summary: Descriptive analysis of early marriages in Niger.
highlights: Programming in SPSS, Stata, and R.
